text: Tullio De Mauro (31 March 1932 - 5 January 2017) was an Italian linguist and politician. He was the Italian Minister of Education from 2000 to 2001, under Prime Minister Giuliano Amato (2nd government). He was also a professor of general linguistics at the Faculty of Humanities of the University of Rome. He was born in Torre Annunziata, Campania. He was elected a member of the Academia Europaea in 1989. De Mauro died on 5 January 2017 in Rome at the age of 84. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1932 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Politicians from Campania Category:Writers from Rome Category:Linguists Category:Italian academics Category:Members of Academia Europaea
